newsitem.title: FRANCE: French wheat firms helped by export, British wheat.
newsitem.headline: French wheat firms helped by export, British wheat.

text.p: Old crop wheat prices rose further on Tuesday, driven by strong shipper activity and firm British wheat prices, dealers said.
One dealer predicted that with sidelined sellers and a heavy loading schedule in ports, prices may hit the new psychological level of 910 francs per tonne this week.
New crop prices also firmed amid tightening old crop supplies and worries over a continued lack of rainfall, notably in the south of France.
Standard quality wheat into Rouen fetched 905 francs per tonne for April and 900 francs for May delivery, both up five francs on Friday.
Wheat into Rouen for September-December delivery was paid at 895 francs per tonne, up five francs on Friday.
MATIF fob barge wheat futures for September were quoted at 900 francs per tonne, up five. Total trade was just 40 lots at 1350 GMT.
